item.title: Bank of Thailand Increases Policy Rate to Tame Inflation
item.description: Thailand’s central bank raised its policy rate as it continued its efforts to tame inflation.

item.title: China Extends Tax Relief Measures to Support Small Businesses
item.description: China’s finance ministry unveiled measures to help struggling small businesses as the economy’s post-Covid-19 recovery loses steam.

item.title: BAE Systems Boosts Guidance on Record Order Book
item.description: BAE Systems raised its full-year forecasts for sales and underlying earnings after it reported above-consensus half-year profits on a record order book.

item.title: Haleon Lifts Forecasts After First-Half Profit Beat
item.description: Haleon posted an adjusted operating profit of £1.3 billion in the first half, slightly ahead of expectations, and raised its full-year guidance for revenue and profit growth.

item.title: Eurozone Bond Yields Drop After US Rating Downgrade
item.description: Eurozone government bond yields fell on the Fitch downgrade but TD Securities said that since the downgrade didn’t come as a surprise, the market reaction is expected to be limited.

item.title: Smurfit Kappa Profits Fall on Lower Volumes
item.description: Smurfit Kappa said its first-half underlying earnings fell to €1.1 billion, though the Ebitda margin rose to 19.1%, and it added that although volumes declined it had market-share gains across many countries.

item.title: Taiwan Unveils Dates for U.S. Stops by Vice President Despite China's Protests
item.description: Lai Ching-te plans to stop in New York and San Francisco this month on his way to and from a formal visit to Paraguay, defying Chinese warnings.

item.title: Hugo Boss Boosts Outlook After Solid Second Quarter
item.description: Hugo Boss upgraded its guidance for 2023, with underlying earnings seen increasing 20%-25%, after it reported stronger second quarter results helped by growth in Asia.

item.title: Fresenius Earnings Weaken on Higher Costs
item.description: Fresenius posted lower profits for the second quarter due to rising costs, higher taxes and negative developments at its hospital subsidiary, but its dialysis business reported positive results, with underlying earnings of €401 million.

item.title: Siemens Healthineers Profits Hit by Covid Test Demand Drop
item.description: Siemens Healthineers reported a drop in third-quarter adjusted earnings to €740 million, due to lower Covid-19 test sales, but it confirmed its revenue and EPS outlook for fiscal 2023.

item.title: Virtual Healthcare Has Green Benefits
item.description: The Covid-19 pandemic gave telehealth a massive push. Now healthcare companies are increasingly appreciating its carbon savings.

item.title: How Russia Helped Turn China Into the World's Biggest Car Exporter
item.description: China is now the world’s largest auto exporter with Russia becoming its biggest buyer this year. WSJ explains how Chinese car brands profited from Moscow’s invasion of Ukraine and Western sanctions.

item.title: Nikkei Falls 2.3% in Biggest Drop in Year to Date
item.description: The Nikkei closed down 2.3%, its biggest percentage-point drop since Dec. 20 and came as uncertainty grows over the global economic outlook following Fitch’s downgrade of the U.S. and on policy tightening by central banks.

item.title: Country Garden Services Shares Jump After Stock Buyback Plan
item.description: Shares of Country Garden Services Holdings jumped after the company said it plans to buy back shares from the open market, signaling confidence in its growth prospects.

item.title: BP said its second-quarter profit dropped almost 70% from the oil giant's year-earlier bonanza, as lower commodity prices and weak refining margins hit results.
item.description: BP said its second-quarter profit dropped almost 70% from the oil giant’s year-earlier bonanza, as lower commodity prices and weak refining margins hit results.

item.title: Shares of indebted trucker Yellow have more than tripled this week, defyingitsrecent shutdown of operations andimpending bankruptcy filing.
item.description: Shares of indebted trucker Yellow have more than tripled this week, defying its recent shutdown of operations and impending bankruptcy filing.

item.title: Fitch downgraded the U.S. government's credit rating weeks after Biden and congressional Republicans came to the brink of a historic default, warning about the growing debt burden and political dysfunction in Washington.
item.description: Fitch downgraded the U.S. government’s credit rating weeks after Biden and congressional Republicans came to the brink of a historic default, warning about the growing debt burden and political dysfunction in Washington.

item.title: Meta offered to seek consent for highly personalized ads in Europe in a bid to end a yearslong tussle over the legality of those ads on the Continent, people familiar with the proposal said.
item.description: Meta offered to seek consent for highly personalized ads in Europe in a bid to end a yearslong tussle over the legality of those ads on the Continent, people familiar with the proposal said.

item.title: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq fell, retreating 0.3% and 0.4%, respectively, while the Dow industrials gained 0.2%.
item.description: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq fell, retreating 0.3% and 0.4%, respectively, while the Dow industrials gained 0.2%.

item.title: Uber's results were highlighted by its first-ever operating profit, a milestone in the firm's long-term efforts to stem losses in its businesses carrying people and delivering food. Revenue rose 14% but slightly missed analyst estimates.
item.description: Uber’s results were highlighted by its first-ever operating profit, a milestone in the firm’s long-term efforts to stem losses in its businesses carrying people and delivering food. Revenue rose 14% but slightly missed analyst estimates.
